intro: Beluttakaka malabarica, commonly known as the Malabar belut, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in dense forests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
